TCM Pattern Name: Lung Qi Deficiency with Shen Disturbance
TCM Pattern Description: Bei Shang Fei Qi Xu (悲伤肺气虚) - Sadness depleting Lung Qi
Key TCM Terms Used: Bei (悲 sadness), Qi Xu (气虚 Qi deficiency), Fei (肺 Lung), Shen Bu An (神不安 Spirit unsettled)
Clinical Notes: Primary grief pattern. Sadness is the emotion of the Lung. Bei Shang Guo Du (excessive sadness) damages Lung Qi.

Western/Common Language Symptom: Can't stop crying, tears come easily
TCM Pattern Name: Lung Qi Xu - Wei Qi Bu Gu
TCM Pattern Description: Lung Qi deficiency - Defensive Qi not consolidating (泪出不止 tears continuously flowing)
Key TCM Terms Used: Lei (泪 tears), Wei Qi Bu Gu (卫气不固 defensive Qi not securing), Fei Qi Xu (肺气虚)
Clinical Notes: Lungs control opening and closing of pores/orifices. When weak, fluids leak out as tears. Spontaneous tearing = Wei Qi deficiency.

TCM Pattern Name: Gan Qi Yu Jie (Liver Qi Stagnation)
TCM Pattern Description: Liver Qi Constraint and Binding (肝气郁结) - Qi not flowing smoothly
Key TCM Terms Used: Yu (郁 constraint/depression), Jie (结 binding), Gan Huo (肝火 Liver Fire), Qi Zhi (气滞 Qi stagnation)
Clinical Notes: Unexpressed grief transforms to Liver constraint. May progress to Gan Huo Shang Yan (Liver Fire flaring upward).

TCM Pattern Name: Qi Xue Liang Xu with Shen Ming Feng Bi
TCM Pattern Description: Qi and Blood dual deficiency with Spirit-Brightness blocked (神明闭塞)
Key TCM Terms Used: Qi Xue Liang Xu (气血两虚 Qi-Blood both deficient), Shen Ming (神明 Spirit-Brightness), Feng Bi (封闭 sealed/blocked)
Clinical Notes: Extreme depletion. Shen cannot manifest. Ma Mu (麻木 numbness) extends to emotions. Severe chronic grief pattern.

TCM Pattern Name: Xin Shen Bu Ning or Xin Dan Qi Qie
TCM Pattern Description: Heart-Spirit not peaceful (心神不宁) or Heart timid Qi timid (心胆气怯)
Key TCM Terms Used: Shen Bu Ning (神不宁 Spirit not calm), Jing Ji (惊悸 fright palpitations), Xin Huo (心火 Heart Fire)
Clinical Notes: Grief affecting Heart. May involve Xin Pi Liang Xu (Heart-Spleen deficiency) or Xin Shen Bu Jiao (Heart-Kidney not communicating).

TCM Pattern Name: Yu Zheng (Depression Pattern)
TCM Pattern Description: Constraint pattern (郁证) - Seven emotions damaging internal organs causing Qi mechanism disorder
Key TCM Terms Used: Qi Ji Yu Zhi (气机郁滞 Qi mechanism stagnant), Qing Zhi Bu Shu (情志不舒 emotions not flowing), Wu Zang Shi Tiao (五脏失调)
Clinical Notes: Yu Zheng has subtypes: Qi Yu, Huo Yu, Tan Yu, Xue Yu, Shi Yu, Shi Yu (6 constraints). Chronic grief progression.

TCM Pattern Name: Xiong Bi or Tan Qi Jiao Jie
TCM Pattern Description: Chest Blockage (胸痹) or Phlegm-Qi Bind and Knot (痰气交结)
Key TCM Terms Used: Xiong Men (胸闷 chest oppression), Qi Zhi (气滞 Qi stagnation), Tan Zu (痰阻 phlegm obstruction)
Clinical Notes: Common grief complication. Xiong Bi usually implies Heart-Lung area. May progress to Xin Xue Yu Zu (Heart Blood stasis).

TCM Pattern Name: Mei He Qi (Plum-Pit Qi)
TCM Pattern Description: Plum-Pit Qi (梅核气) - sensation of obstruction that cannot be swallowed or expectorated
Key TCM Terms Used: Yan Zhong Ru Zu (咽中如阻 throat as if obstructed), Tan Qi Hu Jie (痰气互结 phlegm-Qi mutually binding)
Clinical Notes: Classic grief pattern. Also called Globus Hystericus. Caused by Qi Yu Sheng Tan (Qi constraint generating phlegm).

Western/Common Language Symptom: Shallow breathing, can't take deep breath
TCM Pattern Name: Fei Qi Bu Xuan Bu Jiang
TCM Pattern Description: Lung Qi not dispersing not descending (肺气不宣不降)
Key TCM Terms Used: Hu Xi Duan Qian (呼吸短浅 breathing short and shallow), Qi Duan (气短 shortness of breath), Fei Shi Xuan Jiang (肺失宣降)
Clinical Notes: Lung's dispersing and descending functions impaired. Fundamental lung dysfunction from grief.

TCM Pattern Name: Gan Qi Yu Jie - Tai Xi
TCM Pattern Description: Liver Qi Stagnation - Long Sighing (太息)
Key TCM Terms Used: Tai Xi (太息 sighing), Shan Tai Xi (善太息 tendency to sigh), Gan Yu Qi Zhi (肝郁气滞)
Clinical Notes: Sighing = body's attempt to move stagnant Liver Qi. Diagnostic sign of Gan Qi Yu Jie.

TCM Pattern Name: Qi Xu or Pi Fei Qi Xu
TCM Pattern Description: Qi deficiency (气虚) or Spleen-Lung Qi deficiency (脾肺气虚)
Key TCM Terms Used: Pi Juan (疲倦 fatigue), Wu Li (无力 weakness), Shen Pi Fa Li (神疲乏力 spirit tired strength lacking)
Clinical Notes: Qi Xu is root pattern. May progress to Yang Xu (Yang deficiency) if prolonged. Involves multiple organs.

Western/Common Language Symptom: Heaviness in body, hard to move
TCM Pattern Name: Shi Kun or Tan Shi Nei Zu
TCM Pattern Description: Dampness Encumbering (湿困) or Phlegm-Dampness internally obstructing (痰湿内阻)
Key TCM Terms Used: Shen Ti Kun Zhong (身体困重 body heavy and encumbered), Pi Xu Sheng Shi (脾虚生湿 Spleen deficiency generating dampness)
Clinical Notes: Spleen weakness from grief fails to transform dampness. Shi (dampness) creates heaviness sensation.

TCM Pattern Name: Yang Xu - Fei Shen Yang Xu
TCM Pattern Description: Yang deficiency (阳虚) - Lung-Kidney Yang deficiency (肺肾阳虚)
Key TCM Terms Used: Wei Han (畏寒 aversion to cold), Shou Zu Bu Wen (手足不温 hands feet not warm), Yang Qi Bu Zu (阳气不足)
Clinical Notes: Prolonged grief depletes Yang. Shang Han (internal cold) from Yang unable to warm body.

TCM Pattern Name: Xin Shen Bu Ning - Bu Mei
TCM Pattern Description: Heart-Spirit not peaceful - Insomnia (不寐)
Key TCM Terms Used: Ru Shui Kun Nan (入睡困难 difficulty entering sleep), Xin Fan (心烦 Heart vexation), Shen Bu Shou She (神不守舍 Spirit not housed)
Clinical Notes: Shen unable to return to its residence (Heart). May be Xin Huo (Heart Fire) or Xin Pi Xu (Heart-Spleen deficiency).

TCM Pattern Name: Xin Pi Liang Xu or Xin Yin Xu
TCM Pattern Description: Heart-Spleen dual deficiency (心脾两虚) or Heart Yin deficiency (心阴虚)
Key TCM Terms Used: Shui Mian Qian or Duo Meng (多梦 many dreams), Ye Jian Yi Xing (夜间易醒 easily wake at night)
Clinical Notes: Cannot maintain sleep. Qi/Blood deficiency (pale tongue) vs Yin deficiency (red tongue, night sweats).

TCM Pattern Name: Gan Huo Rao Shen or Xin Huo Wang
TCM Pattern Description: Liver Fire harassing Spirit (肝火扰神) or Heart Fire blazing (心火旺)
Key TCM Terms Used: Meng Yan Duo (梦魇多 many nightmares), Shen Bu An (神不安 Spirit not peaceful), Huo Re Rao Shen (火热扰神)
Clinical Notes: Constraint transforming to Fire. Dreams = Shen disturbed by heat. Red tongue tip confirms.

Western/Common Language Symptom: No appetite, don't want to eat
TCM Pattern Name: Pi Wei Qi Xu or Gan Pi Bu He
TCM Pattern Description: Spleen-Stomach Qi deficiency (脾胃气虚) or Liver-Spleen disharmony (肝脾不和)
Key TCM Terms Used: Na Chai (纳呆 poor appetite), Shi Yu Bu Zhen (食欲不振 appetite not aroused), Pi Wei Xu Ruo (脾胃虚弱)
Clinical Notes: Grief depletes Spleen or Liver invades Spleen. Na (appetite) controlled by Spleen.

TCM Pattern Name: Pi Xu Shi Zhi or Gan Yu Pi Xu
TCM Pattern Description: Spleen deficiency food stagnation (脾虚食滞) or Liver constraint Spleen deficiency (肝郁脾虚)
Key TCM Terms Used: Fu Zhang (腹胀 abdominal distension), Shi Hou Zhang Man (食后胀满 fullness after eating), Pi Yun Bu Jian (脾运不健)
Clinical Notes: Spleen transportation function impaired. Combined with Liver constraint = Xiao Yao San pattern.

TCM Pattern Name: Pi Xu Xie Xie or Pi Shen Yang Xu
TCM Pattern Description: Spleen deficiency diarrhea (脾虚泄泻) or Spleen-Kidney Yang deficiency (脾肾阳虚)
Key TCM Terms Used: Da Bian Tang Xie (大便溏泻 loose stools), Qing Gu Bu Shi (清谷不实 undigested food), Pi Xu Shi Sheng (脾虚湿盛)
Clinical Notes: Pi Xu Sheng Shi (Spleen deficiency generates dampness). Chronic = Kidney Yang also involved.

TCM Pattern Name: Si Lu Guo Du - Pi Qi Xu
TCM Pattern Description: Excessive thinking (思虑过度) damaging Spleen Qi
Key TCM Terms Used: Si (思 thinking/worry - Spleen emotion), You Si (忧思 worry-thinking), Si Ze Qi Jie (思则气结 thinking causes Qi binding)
Clinical Notes: Si damages Spleen. Rumination = Spleen's Yi (intention) function disrupted. Classic Si Shang Pi (thinking harms Spleen).

TCM Pattern Name: Gan Yang Shang Kang or Qi Xue Bu Zu
TCM Pattern Description: Liver Yang rising (肝阳上亢) or Qi-Blood insufficient (气血不足)
Key TCM Terms Used: Tou Tong (头痛 headache), Tou Zhang (头胀 head distension), Qing Yang Bu Sheng (清阳不升 clear Yang not ascending)
Clinical Notes: Excess type (Liver Yang, wiry pulse) vs deficiency (Qi-Blood Xu, weak pulse). Location matters for diagnosis.

Western/Common Language Symptom: Chest pain that's sharp and fixed
TCM Pattern Name: Xin Xue Yu Zu or Xue Fu Yu Xue
TCM Pattern Description: Heart Blood stasis (心血瘀阻) or Blood stasis in chest (血府瘀血)
Key TCM Terms Used: Xiong Tong (胸痛 chest pain), Ci Tong (刺痛 stabbing pain), Tong Chu Gu Ding (痛处固定 pain location fixed)
Clinical Notes: Long-term grief Qi stagnation → Blood stasis. Purple tongue, choppy pulse. Xue Fu Zhu Yu Tang pattern.

TCM Pattern Name: Qi Xue Bu Zu or Qi Zhi Xue Yu
TCM Pattern Description: Qi-Blood insufficient (气血不足) or Qi stagnation Blood stasis (气滞血瘀)
Key TCM Terms Used: Zhou Shen Suan Tong (周身酸痛 generalized soreness pain), Bu Rong Bu Tong (不荣不通 lack of nourishment, lack of flow cause pain)
Clinical Notes: Bu Rong Ze Tong (deficiency pain - dull, likes pressure) vs Bu Tong Ze Tong (excess pain - sharp, dislikes pressure).

TCM Pattern Name: Wei Qi Bu Gu or Fei Wei Qi Xu
TCM Pattern Description: Defensive Qi not consolidating (卫气不固) or Lung-Defensive Qi deficiency (肺卫气虚)
Key TCM Terms Used: Yi Gan Mao (易感冒 easily catch cold), Wai Gan Pin Fa (外感频发 frequent exterior invasions), Zheng Qi Bu Zu (正气不足)
Clinical Notes: Wei Qi produced by Lung. Deficiency = porous exterior. Biao Xu (exterior deficiency). Yu Ping Feng San pattern.

TCM Pattern Name: Zi Han - Qi Xu
TCM Pattern Description: Spontaneous sweating (自汗) - Qi deficiency
Key TCM Terms Used: Bai Tian Chu Han (白天出汗 daytime sweating), Wei Qi Bu Mi (卫气不密 defensive Qi not secure), Qi Xu Bu Gu (气虚不固)
Clinical Notes: Vs night sweats (Dao Han 盗汗) = Yin deficiency. Spontaneous daytime = Yang/Qi deficiency.

TCM Pattern Name: Shen Qi Xu or Shen Jing Bu Zu
TCM Pattern Description: Kidney Qi deficiency (肾气虚) or Kidney Essence insufficient (肾精不足)
Key TCM Terms Used: Yao Xi Suan Ruan (腰膝酸软 lumbar-knee soreness weakness), Shen Xu Yao Tong (肾虚腰痛 Kidney deficiency lower back pain)
Clinical Notes: Kidneys govern lower back and knees. Prolonged grief depletes pre-heaven essence (Xian Tian Zhi Jing 先天之精).

TCM Pattern Name: Shen Jing Kui Xu or Shen Xu
TCM Pattern Description: Kidney Essence depletion (肾精亏虚) or Kidney deficiency (肾虚)
Key TCM Terms Used: Er Ming (耳鸣 tinnitus), Er Long (耳聋 deafness), Shen Kai Qiao Yu Er (肾开窍于耳 Kidneys open to ears)
Clinical Notes: Kidneys open to ears. Essence deficiency = tinnitus. High pitch = Xu; low pitch = Shi.

TCM Pattern Name: Shen Qi Bu Zu or Xin Dan Qi Xu
TCM Pattern Description: Kidney Qi insufficient (肾气不足) or Heart-Gallbladder Qi deficiency (心胆气虚)
Key TCM Terms Used: Kong (恐 fear - Kidney emotion), Dan Qie (胆怯 timidity), Kong Ze Qi Xia (恐则气下 fear makes Qi descend)
Clinical Notes: Fear = Kidney emotion. Prolonged grief transforms to fear as Kidneys deplete. Kong Shang Shen (fear damages Kidneys).

TCM Pattern Name: Qing Zhi Yin Su - pattern varies
TCM Pattern Description: Emotional factors (情志因素) - pattern depends on which organ/channel affected
Key TCM Terms Used: Qing Zhi Bu Sui (情志不遂 emotions not flowing), Qi Ji Shi Tiao (气机失调 Qi mechanism out of balance)
Clinical Notes: Emotions as etiology. Assess which of Qi Nu You Si Bei Kong Jing (anger, worry, sadness, fear, shock) dominates.

TCM Pattern Name: Bu Ding Zhuan - Xu Shi Cuo Za
TCM Pattern Description: Unfixed Complaint (不定诉) - Deficiency-Excess complex (虚实错杂)
Key TCM Terms Used: Zheng Zhuang Duo Bian (症状多变 symptoms changeable), Gen Ben Zai Qi Xue (root in Qi-Blood), Biao Xian Zai Qing Zhi (manifests in emotions)
Clinical Notes: Modern = functional disorder. TCM = Qi mechanism disorder with multi-organ involvement. Requires pattern differentiation.
